Tucson was good at ignoring torment.  Especially when it came from Hydras o=
r the other Predacons and Decepticons.  He then realized by the feel of his=
 restraints, that yes, they were next to near impossible from escape. To br=
eak them was not an option, but, perhaps Ninjabot training could come in ha=
ndy as far as finding ways around the loop holes.  He could sense that the =
more he expanded his hydraulics on his wrists and ankles, the tigher and le=
ss comfortable they were on him.  Meditation again would come in handy.  Th=
e more he relaxed, the more limber his body would become.  Perhaps even lim=
ber enough to give him more room to move in his tight quarters.  Yet he was=
 still waiting to hear Rodimus's reply to his question.  When the answer do=
esn't come, he realizes that he'd have to get through to him a different wa=
y.

" I remember the battle, although it was a bitter memory. We were despe=
rately fighting against Hydras, me myself, barely able to fend off the Pred=
acons, but I did.  Then, it started to happen.  Things were getting out of =
control real fast and there were no more Autobots with considerable speed a=
vailable, for diversionary tactics.  In that time, I was open to assist, an=
d then everything was happening at once. You were being chased, along with =
windlord and Nightlight.  Being who I am, and who I was at the time, to me,=
 there was no such thing as failure.  So, I transformed into vehicle mode, =
and I went as fast as my wheels could take me, although not very fast to yo=
ur standards, but to mine it was far beyond my usual caliber.  I yelled out=
 your name, and I told you to hold on because I was comming to help you.  I=
 was able to divert the attention away from you and direct it my way.  What=
 I didn't see comming was an energy blast that hit me square in my director=
y, causing me to fall into immediate stasis, and before I knew it, everythi=
ng went black, and after that, nothing.  I lost everything.  My sight, and =
even a good portion of my memory.  But most of all, I lost the leader that =
I respected loyally, and two of my most valuable comrades.  I lost you all =
because of me, and you think I'm happy with that?  I'm not.  Because of me =
you are now how you are, and I'll have that guilt with me for as long as I =
live.   But I'm learning to move on Rodimus, as painful it is for me to rem=
ember the past, I'm moving on.  And I believe I can help you do the same, i=
f - you can trust me.  Hydras would never promise you the support only a fe=
llow Autobot can offer, and he would never accept failure as a learning exp=
erience.  But to me, Failure is just a nother step toward self improvement.=
  You fall, you get back up, and you roll again.  You look back at what you=
 did wrong and you correct it.  It's all right to make mistakes Rodimus, Pr=
imus knows I've made more than my fair share already."

He hoped that his a=
pproach would possibly break some ground beneath them.

In another cell in =
the fortress, Night Shift remains calm knowing that Tucson Prime wasn't rea=
lly about to give into Hydras.  A new plan was in action and all he had to =
do was wait.  Although, getting out of the handcuffs was also on his mind. =
 He didn't much care for them, since they were irritating the metal around =
his wrists.

"Slag these things itch like mad."

He tries to scratch the it=
chiness that the cuffs cause him.

Outside the fortress, Rat Trap observes =
Phobia's reaction to Quickstride's noxious gas explusion.  He sees how euph=
oric it makes her.  With his ratty little mind, he gets an idea.

"Hmmmm...=
.  I think someone's gettn a buzz off of your fumes Quickstride.  Although =
I dunno what's so great about it, because it smells worse than a rotting ca=
rcass."

Quickstride's ears flicker back and forth.  He slows from a gallop=
, to a canter and eases himself from trot to walk, turning around to watch =
the Decepticons heading toward the black fortress.

"Hmmm.... Really?  Gett=
n' a buzz off my aft gas huh?  Which one?"

Rat Trap looks around in the sk=
y.

"Well, the redn' white one that just acted a little goofy up there..  T=
hat's the one.  I dunno who that Decepticreep is, but definitely got tipsy =
off that gas."

Quickstride finds more bean pods and stuffs his mouth with =
them.

"If that's the case, then, when in doubt... Stink'em out.  C'mon Rat=
 Trap, we're gon' back."

Rat Trap gasps.

"ARE YOU OUTA YOUR DIRECTORY?!  =
CAN WE SAY SLAGGED IN SECONDS, YA OVER RATED JACKAFT?!"

Quickstride looks =
to Rat Trap.  He swallows a whole bunch of bean pods down.

"Maybe I am.  T=
rust me, the more I eat, the better this'll get".

He then trots back towar=
d the fortress, turns his rump around, lifts his tail and breaks the wind a=
round him, sending another gassy cloud of fumes through the wind.  

"Ohh y=
eahhh, nice'n stinky..   Let's see if they'll buy the bait."
